Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2010 11:24AM KAM1 wrote: Linda, Hoorayyyyy what great news!  We love to hear words like stable and regression!  What a way to celebrate such good news by seeing your daughter off to her prom, how wonderful.  I wish you continued success with your current treatment and many more days of grinning from ear to ear!. Take care, Kim
Posts.Title: Taxol + Avastin = Love with the Stable Boy! LC815 Lowrider54

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2010 10:21AM KAM1 wrote: I agree with Reneepals, you will eventually lose your hair on Adriamycin.  I began noticing the sensitive scalp thing after my second round of chemotherapy and the hair began falling out almost immediately after that.  I say if you have wigs that you are happy with and you are ready for the head shaving, go with your instinct and do it.  I had a head shaving party with my husband, kids, sister and best friend, each one got a chance with the clippers.  I found it easier to be in charge of when my hair would be gone rather than letting chemo and cancer dictate that.  I'm keeping you in my thoughts and prayers, enjoy the wedding.
Posts.Title: Shaving my head today lorrhaw dreamwriter

Posts.Content: May 12, 2011 10:16AM - edited May 12, 2011 10:16AM by KAM1 Thank you so much for all your replies to my post.  Although I am not new to the boards, I rarely post and am so happy that I finally did about my nail issues as I have received so many great ideas.  I am definitely going to try the suggestion of ice!  There was a product that was suggested to me that I thought I would pass on to all of you called Evonail Hydrating Nail Solution.  Although I have not yet tried the product, the reviews seemed very good and I am seriously considering it.  I wish all of you well and again want to thank you for your quick responses and suggestions.  Have a great day!! Kim

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2010 08:24AM KAM1 wrote: I was also on Aromasin and due to progression was taken off of and started Faslodex in January, 2010.  All of the side effects from the Aromasin (and there were many) have subsided and I have not experienced any side effects from Faslodex.  I will say that I seem to be more tired than before but compared to side effects of Aromasin this is easy.  I usually do my treatment on Friday and by Saturday night I'm feeling more like myself.  Sending you good thoughts as you start on Faslodex, I think you will be fine to travel on Monday for your trip.  Good Luck!
Posts.Title: Looking for info on Faslodex Lynn1 Lynn1

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2010 09:14PM KAM1 wrote: I also had a difficult time with Zometa -  fever, chills etc.  My oncologist switched me to Aredia and I am happy to say I have had no side effects.  As Jan said, the infusion is administered slower but I'll give up 1.5 hours for no SE.  Good luck with the next Zometa infusion and if you have a difficult time again, ask your onc about Aredia.  Good luck! Kim

Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2011 11:55AM KAM1 wrote: I just completed my first round of Xeloda and had horrible side effects from it, I was taking 4 pills in the am and 5 in the pm.  It started with nausea/vomiting and I lost almost 10 lbs. in two weeks.  I could not eat or sleep because the cramping in my stomach was so bad.  I was so sick from this medication, I ended up in the hospital for 3 days due to inflammation and infection in and around the bowl and intestines. Xeloda also caused hyper pigmentation of my hands, but no peeling or cracking thank goodness!   After coming home from the hospital, my oncologist and I decided that Xeloda was probably not the right medication for me and I will now be starting Havalen next Friday.  Best of luck to your Mom, and Happy Thanksgiving to all!! Kim

Posts.Content: May 29, 2011 07:08PM KAM1 wrote: I have been on Abraxane since January and am having a similar problem only with my finger nails.  My nails began to lift and had become very painful.  I soak my nails in epsom salt twice a day (as directed by my oncologist) and have started applying evonail hydrating nail solution which I purchased at amazon.com.  The reviews for this product were so good that I just had to give it a try, and I must say, I have seen a remarkable improvement in my nails since I started using evonail.  Good Luck!!

Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2010 07:46AM KAM1 wrote: I started on Faslodex in January, 09 with no side effects and just had my 2 month scans.  No prgression in bone or liver!!  I seem to be stable for now and will continue with the 1x monthly Faslodex and Aredia treatment.  I had not heard about the study saying Faslodex 2x monthly had better results so I will be talking to my onc about that at my next visit!  Thank you so much for the information, this site has been so helpful to me.  Good luck with the Faslodex, I hope you have success with it.  Take care, Kim
